means: （门）嘎吱作响( creak的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The creaking of the hinges sounded very loud in that silence.
sentence.Network_cn: 在那片寂静之中，铰链吱吱嘎嘎的声音听起来很响。

sentence.Network_en: She heard one of Harry's doors creaking and threw on some clothes.
sentence.Network_cn: 她听见哈里的车门嘎嘎作响,就披衣起床.

sentence.Network_en: " All right,'said Drouet, creaking off in his good shoes toward the elevator.
sentence.Network_cn: “ 好的, ” 杜洛埃说, 穿着双高级皮鞋.嘎吱嘎吱地朝电梯走去.

entry.def: If something creaks, it makes a short, high-pitched sound when it moves.

example.ex: The steps creaked beneath his feet...
example.tran: 楼梯在他脚下嘎吱作响。

sentences.sentence: "the creak of the floorboards gave him away"

means.word_mean: 1. having a rasping or grating sound;

sentences.sentence: "they were alerted by the creaking gate"
